questions.text: A 26 year woman presents with a palpable thyroid nodule, and needle biopsy demonstrates amyloid in the stroma of the lesion. A cervical lymph node is palpable on the same side as the lesion, the preferred treatment should be

options.label: A
options.text: Removal of the involved node, the isthmus, and the enlarged lymph node.

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of the involved lobe, the isthmus, a portion of the opposite lobe, and the enlarged lymph node.

options.label: C
options.text: Total thyroidectomy and modified neck dissection on the side of the enlarged lymph node.

options.label: D
options.text: Total thyroidectomy and irradiation of the cervical lymph nodes.

questions.correct_answer: C. Total thyroidectomy and modified neck dissection on the side of the enlarged lymph node.

A 45 year old male presents with 4x4 cm, mobile right solitary thyroid nodule of 5 months duration. The patient is euthyroid. The following statements about his management are true except

options.label: A
options.text: Cold nodule on thyroid scan is diagnostic of malignancy

options.label: B
options.text: FNAC is the investigation of choice

options.label: C
options.text: The patient should undergo hemithyroidectomy if FNAC report is inconclusive

options.label: D
options.text: Indirect laryngoscopy should be done in the preoperative period to assess mobility of vocal cords.

questions.correct_answer: A. Cold nodule on thyroid scan is diagnostic of malignancy

questions.text: A 20 yr old girl presents with 9 month history of neck swelling with thyrotoxic symptoms. On investigation increased T4 and decreased TSH with palpable 2 cm nodule was found. Next investigation will be

questions.text: BRCA-1 gene mutations

options.label: A
options.text: Result in cancers that are usually hormone receptor negative

options.label: B
options.text: Have a high incidence in Sephardic Jews

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. Result in cancers that are usually hormone receptor negative

questions.text: Paget’s disease

options.label: A
options.text: Is associated with underlying lobular carcinoma

options.label: B
options.text: Can be differentiated from melanoma by carcinoembryonic antigen staining

options.label: C
options.text: Is self-limiting and requires no treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Is diagnosed by characteristic skin changes in the axilla

questions.correct_answer: B. Can be differentiated from melanoma by carcinoembryonic antigen staining
